result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on November 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.

9:06 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Pa Kou Yang appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Steven G. Richards appeared by video for Pa Kou Yang.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Richards is heard on the status of the cases. 
Court approves Plea and Sentencing via Zoom
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Pa Kou Yang
Current: 1300 Lange Court, c/o Sauk County Jail, Baraboo, WI 53913 United States  (Effective: 06-15-2022)
Prior: 115 West Doty Street, Dane County Jail - Public Safety Bldg, Madison, WI 53703 United States

11:34 AM Cases 22CF43, 22CF53, 22CF54 & 22CF55 called - appearances stated. 
Defendant Pa Kou Yang appeared by video, in custody.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin appeared by video.  Attorney Steven G. Richards appeared by video for Pa Kou Yang. 
Atty Steiner moves to dismiss without prejudice 22CF54 (duplicated by Federal Indictment)
Atty. Richards has no objection
Court dismisses 22CF54 upon motion of the state without prejudice

Atty Richards is heard on the status of the remaining cases - both he & D.A. looking to see what happens in Federal charges - should know more by Sept. Requests JSH in September
Jury status hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Status hearing on June 15, 2022 at 11:30 am.

9:22 AM Cases 22CF43, 22CF53, 22CF54, 22CF55  called - appearances stated. 
Attorney Steven G. Richards appeared by video for Pa Kou Yang.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Steiner is heard on status - is aware of Federal indictment, some of these matters may be dismissed as they are duplicated in federal charges

Court will set status
Status hearing scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Jury status hearing on May 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.

11:08 AM Call to Order by Court. Appearances stated: Defendant Pa Kou Yang appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Steven G. Richards in court for Pa Kou Yang.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Richards is heard on status of all cases.  22CF43, 22CF53, 22CF54, 22CF55

22CF53, 22CF54, 22CF55 - Court reviews preliminary questionnaire and waiver of rights form with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. Court accepts waiver and finds that the defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives right to preliminary hearing. Court finds probable cause and binds matter over for further proceedings. 

22CF53, 22CF54, 22CF55 Atty Richards is heard on all three cases, waives reading of the information. Defendant will stand mute, upon defendant standing mute clerk will enter a not guilty plea into the record as to each count in each of these cases.  

22CF43 - Atty Richards is heard on Bond Modification. Requests a $1,000.00 cash bond. 
State opposes bond modification.  DA is heard on position. 

22CF43 Court - No bond modification will be made.  Bond remains the same.
Jury status hearing scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw.
Adjourned initial appearance on April 11, 2022 at 11:00 am.

11:30 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Pa Kou Yang appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Steven G. Richards appeared by video for Pa Kou Yang.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

*This was not a waiver of preliminary hearing. It was a motion hearing and initial appearances.  Minutes reflect correctly. System will not allow for court record event title change.


22CF43 Motion Hearing: 
Atty Erickson is heard. Atty Steiner is heard and requests that motion denied. 
Court is heard, bond will remain as $5,000.00 cash bond.


Initial Appearances:
2022CF000053 - Court informs Def. of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Def. states understanding.  Right to counsel is explained. 
2022CF000054 - Court informs Def. of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Def. states understanding.  Right to counsel is explained. 
2022CF000055 - Court informs Def. of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Def. states understanding.  Right to counsel is explained. 

State is heard on bond. State requests that 1,000.00 cash bond for each of the cases - 22CF53, 22CF54, 22CF55. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. 

Court orders for 22CF53, 22CF54, 22CF55 a $1,000.00 signature bond for each of the cases. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Initial appearance on April 6, 2022 at 11:30 am.
